Hi Robin,

Maybe you will be interested in using one or both of our two car
racing-based benchmarks:

The first, simplerace, is well formalized and fast to run, and full
source code (in Java) with easy-to-follow instructions on how to run
it is available at:
http://julian.togelius.com/cec2007competition/
For some papers, see...
http://julian.togelius.com/Togelius2008Countering.pdf (rather
extensive set of benchmarks)
http://julian.togelius.com/Togelius2007Multipopulation.pdf (more benchmarks)
http://julian.togelius.com/thesis.pdf (full description of the problem
and simulator)

Variations of it has been used in tens of other papers by me and others.

The other is the TORCS-based environment for the CIG 2008 competition.
It is more complex to set up, slower, and as yet not fully formalized.
But the graphics look good!
http://cig.dei.polimi.it/?page_id=67

Good luck with your benchmarking!

Julian


2008/11/13 dr_robbe <mai02igw@...-leipzig.de>:
> Hi all,
>
> in my diploma thesis I'm trying to benchmark a few neural evolution
> approaches. So far i came up with a few, I'd say less complex problems
> for testing.
> So far I got the following:
> - XOR, (a xor b) and (c xor d)
> - Pole Balancing
> - Obstacle Navigator
> - Khepera Robot Simulator
> - two spiral classification
> - mathematical function approximation
>
> Does anyone have some more complex problems which can be evaluated in
> bearable time on a dual core, maybe something involving ODE.
>
> Robin
>
>
